title: [BEAM-13399] Add infrastructure to start JARs from Go functions
body:
Adds wrappers around exec package functionality to enable starting/stopping expansion service JARs. Takes a jar path from the GetBeamJar() function and attempts to start up the service. Also adds unit testing for the functionality, sanity-checking behavior. Full functionality will be tested in an integration test (to be added later) as actually downloading and spinning up JARs has an external dependency on Maven. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-13445] Correctly set data limit when flushing S3 upload buffer
body:
This bug surfaced when adding integration tests for the S3FileSystem. Localstack rejected the `uploadPart` request because the MD5 content hash did not match. This is due to all the additional `\x00` visible in the logs below. Without these the content hash matches. See details here https://github.com/localstack/localstack/issues/4987 ``` 2021-12-08T09:07:41.998:DEBUG:localstack.services.edge: IN(s3): "PUT /bucket/.temp-beam-80964f9c-01a1-421c-950c-7790a04ead45/dea81bd6481b9750-08a8-422d-8c27-ecda870db803?partNumber=1&uploadId=iYYXz61AHHdLdEMIAo7BCFjJBUK0IFk5hxAHzPbwhDw9U9bq2mNuK1bsA" - title: [BEAM-13441] Use S3 quiet mode for deletes
body:
A trivial performance improvement for deletes to save a bit of bandwith as the response of the service calls is currently ignored. https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/API/API_DeleteObjects.html > The action supports two modes for the response: verbose and quiet. By default, the action uses verbose mode in which the response includes the result of deletion of each key in your request. In quiet mode the response includes only keys where the delete action encountered an error. For a successful deletion, the action does not return any information about the delete in the response body. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-13391] Fix temporary file format in WriteToBigQuery
body:
Fixing the issue where for Avro format load, `WriteToBigQuery` throws an exception: `The Apache Avro library failed to parse the header with the following error: EOF reached`. This happens because AVRO format exects non-zero input. This cannot be possible because [UpdateDestinationSchema](https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/9ce826ed492b8a64265f133b56b8158c883783b7/sdks/python/apache_beam/io/gcp/bigquery_file_loads.py#L323) desinged to update a schema with a zero copy-payload. Current PR: * Fixes a format for copy job in `UpdateDestinationSchema` to be a JSON. JSON is choosen because it allows a zero-rows payload and nested schema * Add an integereation tests ## Testing Integration tests: ``` pytest --log-cli-level=INFO --test-pipeline-options='--region=us-central1 --experiment=use_beam_bq_sink --runner=TestDirectRunner --project=... --gcs_location gs://... --temp_location gs://...' -v apache_beam/io/gcp/bigquery_write_it_test.py ``` cc: @pabloem - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). `ValidatesRunner` compliance status (on master branch) --------------------------------------------------------

title: [BEAM-13384] Re-exported the metrics subpackage in apache_beam
body:
This PR re-exports the `metrics` subpackage in `apache_beam/__init__.py`. This has no effect at runtime, but it has two important consequences for Python SDK users * It is now legal to define metrics via `beam.metrics.Metrics` * Static analysis tools (type checkers, linters, IDEs) would be able to understand what `beam.metrics` refers to, and could thus offer checks, refactorings, completions etc. No change is expected for existing Python SDK users. `ValidatesRunner` compliance status (on master branch) --------------------------------------------------------

title: [BEAM-13243][BEAM-8374] Add support for missing PublishResponse fields in SnsIO.Write (AWS SDK v2)
body:
This PR addresses the outstanding support for relevant fields of a SNS `PublishResponse` using `SnsIO.Write` on AWS SDK v2. This is critical in order to check the HTTP status for errors since the current implementation only encodes the messageId field. Support for SDK v1 was added in https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/9758. This PR simply ports those changes to SDK v2 to eventually reach feature parity. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-13244] Support STS Assume role credentials provider for AWS SDK v2
body:
Java IOs for AWS SDK v1 already have support for STS assume role credentials. This adds similar support for AWS SDK v2. However, it's critical to note that support is limited. - After deserialization the `StsAssumeRoleCredentialsProvider` will always use the default STS client, regardless of what client was configured. The same limitation applies to the current support for AWS SDK v1. - Also, the `StsAssumeRoleCredentialsProvider` may be configured to provide a `AssumeRoleRequest` on demand through a `Supplier` function. After deserialization the `StsAssumeRoleCredentialsProvider` will always use the `AssumeRoleRequest` that was provided during serialization. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable.
